result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Leonard Lester Spencer was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine $2715.00 to be paid during probation.
Submit DNA sample and pay $250.00 surcharge if not previously done.

No firearms or body armor.    Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.    Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess or consume prescription medications without a valid prescription and then only according to Dr.'s orders.  All prescriptions shall be verified by the agent.    May not be in taverns or bars or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants and grocery stores.

Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.    Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.  AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare; if any portion takes place within a state penal institution, continuation of accepted aftercare treatment upon release to extended supervision.  Successfully complete a cognitive intervention program.  Pay costs of supervision.  Must comply with all recommendations of agent.  Submit to regular drug testing.

timeConds.notes:
Good time, credit for 64 days and huber release if in compliance with jail rules and regulations.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: from def requesting ERP eligibility - denied by Court
from def requesting correction of credit for time served - denied by Court

12:58 pm 
Defendant Leonard Lester Spencer in court with attorney Bradley J. Schraven.  Defendant Leonard Lester Spencer in custody.  Allen R. Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA takes no issue with PSI
Atty Schraven spks on PSI
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Schraven spks on sentencing
Court imposes:  Imposed & Stayed 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.   Def is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  3 years probation.  Conditions:
6 months jail, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 64 days, good time,  huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Fine $2715.00 to be paid during probation.
36 month DL revocation
Ignition Interlock
Alcohol assessment
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge if not previously done.
No firearms or body armor.
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances or illegal drugs unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to possess or consume prescription medications without a valid prescription and then only according to Dr.'s orders.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare; if any portion takes place within a state penal institution, continuation of accepted aftercare treatment upon release to extended supervision.
Successfully complete a cognitive intervention program.
May not be in taverns or bars or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants and grocery stores.
Pay costs of supervision.
Must comply with all recommendations of agent.
Submit to regular drug testing.
Atty Schraven spks on def's other case 13CT5 - requests payment plan inception date be delayed
Court orders new payment plan in 13CT5 - new commencing date of 1-1-15.
1:34 pm
